Reviews.Title: “Olive Hotel Not Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Florence86
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed by the standards in this hotel and it did not reflect good value for money. Not happy at all with the bedrooms. The first one was shocking and I would have left but it had been prepaid. The room was old and smelt and bedding was sheets and blankets I told reception I could not stay there. Then she showed me to a slightly better room and we suffered it but again I was not happy so we went out and came back and went to bed. Surprisingly, the bed was comfortable, but my companion had been bitten by the morning. Breakfast was not very inspiring and the service was not good nor the quality of the food and bevereges. Coffee was spooned out of a large can of Nescafé Instant and the waitress growled at me when I asked for a drink after a 10 minute wait. The proprietors should take a walk up to the Coronation Hotel in Neven place to get some idea of simple but good standards of hotel keeping and service, as currently the Olive Hotel Cromwell Rd reflects very poor value for money. Do not mistake his hotel with Olive Plaza Hotels which has high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but solid.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerRussell
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel on business trip and all that can be said is that you get what u pay for. Used it as a place to crash at night. you get solid personal service from owner/manager as is hands on. Treat staff with respect and one will be treated as such.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJBCarrots
Reviews.Content: We were here for just one night to see a performance at the Royal Albert Hall and then to shop / visit the natural History Museum. The hotel was well placed for us to walk to where we wanted to be and by taking a family room for £120 the four of us could afford to visit London. When I was looking at alternative accomodation most hotels would only provide 2 rooms so the cost was upwards of £200 for us. For the money we got a reasonable sized room with a shower / toilet. It was big enough and everything worked, other than a couple of light bulbs. It was reasonably clean. It was quiet and the beds, a double and something a bit bigger were comfortable. In the morning there was a table service breakfast with boiled eggs, ham, toast and jam and coffee. If you wanted more of anything you could have it. The food was basic but fine and there was plenty but limited choice. A note on car parking. after I think 7pm on saturday you can park your car free outside the hotel until early Monday am but otherwise you need to park it elsewhere. I paid £25 to park in the car parking spaces the hotel has just over the road. It is an under ground car park and you need to ask for clear instructions on how to get in and out on foot. You drive in with a tag which the barrier recognises but you can not walk out the same way. You have to find the right door which is not marked up and use the tag to let you in to the flats above the car park. The staff we met spoke quite limited English but they did their best for us. I guess they don't earn a lot and we made the small effort to be polite and they were helpful. I think for what we wanted, that is a cheap place to sleep and have breakfast, it was fine. I can not imagine staying here for more than a few days. For London it is good value ( a one course meal for 4 cost £50 for reference) and we would stay here again. We were in the new part of the hotel so can not comment on the rest of it but it seemed quite busy and I heard no complaints but it is basic.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Leeofmani
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for public transport, in a safe and pleasant area. The staff was pleasant and helpfull. The room was small but clean and had a safe, a television, a hairdryer, a trouser press and plenty of storage and overlooked nice quiet gardens behind the hotel. The en suite shower was the smallest I have ever seen, you could not bend down to pick up the soap if you dropped it (but other hotels at the same price only had shared bathrooms so I didn't mind). There was a nice lounge with large television and comfy chairs. The breakfast was nothing exciting but quite adequate. For the price I paid, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking, disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: This place isn't clean. I was horrified by the bedding and was never comfortable for a minute. The staff was unpleasant, the breakfast not good. It was traumatic to stay here. I'm returning to London soon and will steer clear of this mess. Every other place I've ever stayed in London -- countless places -- was far better. I was stuck in tourist season, not having planned ahead enough. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Gulag”
Reviews.Author: Kevin F
Reviews.Content: I have driven across the US and stayed in some pretty questionable hotels, but when I come to London I know that I have to be, shall we say "flexible" about my expectations for a hotel room. I realize that when traveling through Europe it's wise to bring your sense of humor however I was totally unprepared for my experience at the Oliver. The first thing you think as you walk through the door is "What's the cancellation policy again?" I was dutifully interrogated by the ex KGB employee who manned the front desk and ushered off to my room. Surprise, yes the room was small...well tiny actually: so welcome to London! All par for the course... but then I saw the bathroom... oh my God. I'm 5 feet 8 inches, not exactly tall but there wasn't enough room for me to sit on the toilet, I had to sit sideways to accommodate my knees! Well that was good for a laugh. (remember, sense of humor required) But I wasn't particularly amused when I tried taking a shower and discovered that there wasn't enough space in the stall to move my arms, I literally had to soak under the water, step out of the shower to soap and scrub and step back in to rinse off! Thank God I was only here for one night. After my shower I made the mistake of going downstairs for the "Continental" breakfast that was included with my stay. What I wasn't told was that the continent in question was Antarctica! Undrinkable coffee, rubbery egg (singular), slimy yogurt and miserable service, there was not one edible thing in the room. And speaking of miserable service...not a single smile the whole time I was there from any of the employees. They offered consistently "Soviet" service that led me to believe that I was really just an annoyance...or an inmate. Needless to say unless you're fresh from the Gulag avoid this place like the plague...which I suspect is being incubated in the bed linens! One last thing, I would love to hear from anyone, ANYONE who has stayed at this hotel and gone back to stay another night.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: Be warned, stayed one night and woke up the next day blotchy and itching all over. Now having to have everything worn dry cleaned / thrown out so as not to transfer home. Avoid room 7, not just for the fact you'll be bitten to death, but you get the added bonus of the kitchen staff making lots of noise just after 6am.... yes, horrible!!! Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising & sleazy night porter”
Reviews.Author: Scott N
Reviews.Content: Firstly it is not 24 hour reception. If you arrive after midnight you have to knock on the door as your key , even if you happen to sneak it out, does not open the main front door. If you can wake somebody up they will let you in at their discretion. My female travel companion arrived back around 2am and was initially refused entry. When he finally let her in he had to escort her to the room for some reason as I had the key and thought it ok to actually attempt to fondle her from behind. She spokento management next day who appeared not surprised yet no real apology or remorse. The matter is now with police. So not only is it not really 24 hr reception it advertises that its only 15 to 20 minute stroll to Oxford st , Harrodsburg etc. This is laughable, we wondered why walking and asking people the directions they looked at us weird. It takes approx 90 mns to walk to Oxford st and that's at a great rate of knots. Avoid this hotel, the rooms are rabbit warrens, staff shonky and sleazy and basically have nothing to offer what they advertise. The breakfast btw is stale toast and hard boiled eggs. Simply a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Micha072
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oliver is in quite location on a main road within walking distance to The Natural History Museum and to Earls Court Tube, buses, also to restaurants and food stores. We liked the breakfast service, coffee and tea faciltites available for free in the tea room 24hr. Also liked the family room. We would definately use again.

Reviews.Title: “Receptionist called an unlicensed driver friend”
Reviews.Author: Vero_7777
Reviews.Content: We asked the hotel receptionist to call a taxi at 4:30 in the morning to take my mother to the airport at a fixed price. A man appeared in a car and instead of taking my mother to the airport gave her a very long drive around London, apparently lost ...and left my mother at another site near the airport after driving in a reckless manner. When my mother got off the "taxi" the driver wanted to charge her much more than what was agreed. My poor mother, who speaks no English, was scared, asked him for his license number, but he wouldn´t answer and had no choice but to call me to speak with the driver. It's amazing that the hotel receptionist called any cheat that besides trying to defraud my mother panicked and put her in danger.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended.”
Reviews.Author: jj_dorg
Reviews.Content: Ended up here for 1 night after my original reservation was cancelled by accident and this was the closest hotel to my location the booking agent could find. Hotel is close to tube. Plenty of shops, pubs and cafes nearby which is good because the less time you spend in this hotel the better. I was in a single room with a bad stale smell. Carpet throughout hotel looks like it's not been cleaned in years. En-suite was tiny and had water stains in the ceiling. Breakfast served in the dining room and even though I arrived just as they were starting the table was dirty with crumbs. Thankful I only stayed one night. Not a hotel I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but the photos are misleading.”
Reviews.Author: BeeTeeIQ
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was reasonably central and close to a tube station so we could spend the evening in central London. Parking was a bit of an issue and we ended up a 15 minute walk away. The photos on here unfortunately make it look better than it is. Not being a negative person I am struggling to find positives. The receptionist was lovely although you are charged the full cost as you book in. Too late to leave then when you see your room. Our £100 room was so tiny you wouldn't be able to have a suitcase in it and there were no facilities in it. The double bed was tiny and difficult for the 2 of us to move about in it. We had to laugh or we would have cried. The curtains didn't come low enough to cut the light out and to top it all having paid £10 deposit on the tv remote control the tv wouldn't work. At breakfast the staff wanted us to share a table with another couple so they didn't have to clear another table. We all refused. An apple, yoghurt and toast were literally plonked in front of us then we were tidied up as we ate. I assume to make us leave faster.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel with Poor Service and Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: DelhiGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel just for one night in London before i shifted to the Holiday Inn. This is a small hotel with just around 50 rooms. London being very expensive, i booked this hotel because the tariff was 110 pounds a night. However, the rooms were very small for my comfort. The bathroom was dirty once i checked in and had to make multiple complaints to get it cleaned up. The airconditioner was very noisy. Overall, a no no to stay. I checked out the very next morning and went to the Holiday Inn close to the Olivers Yard where my office is

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Purplegiddy
Reviews.Content: We were almost put off staying here because of the bad reviews however the staff were polite and helpful, the room whilst on the small side was spotless and even though we were at the front of the hotel we weren't bothered by traffic noise. Breakfast was a bonus! Conveniently located and at a good price we would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: voyager8472
Reviews.Content: For the price the hotel was very good. I was happy with my stay and will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, nice clean rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Reimar1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather good value for money. We lived in a new/modernized part of the hotel, nice quite and clean room, good location in West London close to shopping, museums etc. Internet in the lobby/breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, but this smell of old ages...”
Reviews.Author: blaszka
Reviews.Content: Good price & location (close to tube, shopping street (High Street Kensington), wi-fi in the room for free BUT very small room, and this smell of never renovated walls and bathroom. Quite noisy if the window is from the road side. Not amasing, but for two nights is too much (1 night you can manage - close everywhere).

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Guillermofog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and cleaned but it is very outdated. For the price we paid for that room there would have been much better alternatives in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful hotel - stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: manc_19
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay here out of choice, it was booked for me by my boss. To be honest after reading the reviews on here I was pretty nervous about my stay at the Oliver and I was right to be. The manager was friendly when I arrived but the phone rang when I was checking in and he was very rude to the guest he was speaking to. This was the general theme of the stay - appalling service. My TV didn't work the first evening I was there and the girl on reception refused to help me, even though all was needed to be done was to change the batteries in the remote. The manager then fixed this the next day but I was left without TV for the whole of the 1st evening. Great! London was very very cold the weekend I was there - not a problem, I'm British, I'm used to the cold. But the hotel refused to turn on the heating. At breakfast every morning all the guests were talking about how they had to sleep fully clothed. Ridiculous!!! The breakfast is OK but very strange. You get toast, a tiny shot of juice and some awful coffee then you can have a boiled egg and also some sandwich ham if you want it. Very, very strange. The location was good for me because I was working at the Earl's Court Exhibition Centre for the time I was there but if I was a tourist I'd be disappointed. There are much better hotels for the same price in better locations than the Oliver. Please don't get me wrong, I'm not picky when it comes to hotels but the Oliver is truly awful. Please save yourself the nightmare and STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!! I recommend one of the Travelodges in the centre if you can get one of their advance deals :)

Reviews.Title: “Such a good location and such a bad quality”
Reviews.Author: Studentica
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good, so close to the centre and museums. I stayed in a double bedroom, which was very, very small, I could barely turn around. The bed was also small, there is no chance that 2 average people can sleep normaly. The room had view on the street, that is quite nice, but you cannot sleep because of the noice. We had no warm water for 4 days and they told us that there is no problem. Breakfast is poor, you have to keep asking staff to bring you more. The towels were disgusting, stinky, wet and gray, already used. They change it every second day. Reportedly. Bedclothes had been used, there were hair all over the bed. Such a shame for a London.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor comfort”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0119
Reviews.Content: Negative aspects about the hotel: - Towels: grey, washed-out and with black lints, hairs and pubes - Other textiles (carpet, bedspread, chair covering): littered with indefinable stains, too dirty to put your cloth on or to walk shoeless in your room - Maid: Always put the clean towels on the bottom of the hotel corridor befor bringing them into your room. Didn´t vacuum the carpet when obviously necessary. - Breakfast: NO BUFFET! Limited portion per guest with 2 slices toast, 1 joghurt, 1 bowl cornflakes. Ham only every 2nd to 3rd day available. Joghurt and cheese also miner quality. Sometimes you also had to wait to be served at your table. Positive aspects: Good location (5 to 7 minutes to walk to Earl´s Cour tube station) and 24 hour reception

Reviews.Title: “economical with good location”
Reviews.Author: KSGC
Reviews.Content: Met our requirements of a clean, economical and well located hotel. Room was basic but clean; good location - close to tube station, bus to oxford circus stops right in front of hotel, eating places nearby; basic breakfast on expected lines; free wifi in breakfast room but slightly unreliable; relatively quiet location though one might hear traffic noise at night if windows are kept open...

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Good”
Reviews.Author: crazychick81
Reviews.Content: Me and A friend travelled from Aberdeen Scotland to London and stayed here for 1 night. we asked for directions when we left the tube station and asked a shop worker and when we said the name of the hotel they man just looked at me and said "oh the hotel oliver oh" which made me panic a little bit as he didnt make it sound a very good place to stay. Anyway when we got there we were surprised that it quite good. it looks nice from the outside and when we went in the man at reception was very helpful. we arrived before the check in time and it wasnt a probelm we paid for the room and went to our room. The room was a little small and the window was really small which made the room really warm and a little airless BUT there was a fan in the room which sorted that problem. The toilet had a shower in it and it was very clean. The only disappointing thing was that in the website it says they have luggage storage and they dont we had to leave our luggage in the dining room and the female receptionist wasnt very helpful she was more interested in flirting with the pizza delivery man.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: piggy35
Reviews.Content: Felt I had to write a review. Stayed in this hotel last year and have just returned from another trip to London where we stayed in a much better hotel for less money which was far superior in every way. This hotel is not very clean, the rooms are so tiny you can touch the bathroom door when lying in bed. The bathroom is so small your knees touch the door. One plus point, the breakfast wan't too bad, but there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. I would seriously advise anyone to trawl the internet and look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor quality”
Reviews.Author: ebo1
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel was fine for us but it was poor value for money...the room was not very clean at all...when i pulled the bedside out i dont think the cleaners ever had, it was filthy...although we hate being cold' the heating was that high we felt like we were boiling in our sleep and had to open the window on a busy road so there was lots of traffic noise!!!!!and we wasnt sure wether it was the cleaners or not, but all morning you could here every door being opened and closed very loudly and constantly...definately dont stay here if you want a lie in!!!!

Reviews.Title: “an average but good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: bebeandjimmy
Reviews.Content: We arrived early so we were given a choice of rooms. The first one was really old, dirty, worn down, basement, cold, like the gutters. The second one on 2nd floor was newly renovated however it was close to the life so it was a bit noisy. The newly renovated one was really cleaner and I would recommend others to get there earlier to get a better room. The indian manager was pushy in selling tours and a bit naieve in asking to sign a consent form when I have already paid and settled my hotel bill before coming. I tried to explin it from both business and legal but he won't listen. Well so becareful of the info you fill in for your personal data and information on how its stored or used. Or how long the data is kept. The location is very close to the warwick exit on earls court. Lots of restaurants but the streets a bit dirty and lots of dogs waste. If you like exotic asian (indian, thai, chinese food, kebab) there are lots of restaurants on the main road. Its actually 15- 20 mins walk to a big tesco. (buy bottle water highly recommend). I found the room was really cold no heating and so we had to use our jackets to cover ourself. I have no idea why the bath room is freezing so take a shower in the daytime. No fridge, or extra pillows, bring own toiletries. IF you are a light sleeper like me you can hear the conversation and tv in the room next door. Hard to sleep. I didn't see any bugs but maybe it was winter and too cold for the bugs hahah. If you are on the petite side you will fit in the lift if not then you have to carry your own luggage upstairs. NO INTERNET SERVICE and breakfast was really expensive 10 pounds per person. wowo

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Oliver”
Reviews.Author: Bobby46
Reviews.Content: This central, comfy hotel is very cosy & homely and close to Kensington High Street and Earls Court Tube Station. A 15 to 20-minute walk will bring you to Harrods, Oxford Street, Hyde Park and Piccadilly. Hotel Oliver is in Central London and is well equipped for a low-price stay. Free tea/coffee is available in the breakfast room 24 hours a day, and there is free wireless internet access. There is easy access to buses and trains. The Piccadilly Line service from Earls Court Tube Station goes directly to Heathrow Airport. Secured car parking is available with prior arrangement.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomSwindon
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked nice and wasn't daftly cheap, so i thought why not? I'll tell you why not. The sink and shower were both broken on arrival, the heating was stuck on, so the room was roasting! The breakfast consisted of 2 toast, 2 slices od processed cheese and a boled egg; this was supposed to be a full english!!!! Worst of all, the bed sheets were covered in dried blood and when i got home, i was covered in bed bug bites. Do not stay at this hotel, you'd better off sleeping in the bs stop outside!!

Reviews.Title: “Four letter word DUMP”
Reviews.Author: Masterbriewer
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is a mess with wires hanging out of the wall. When going to our first room we found the sink would not dran and the room was dirty. Gave us keys to two other rooms to find what we liked. Both were dirty and every thing in both rooms looked like a war zone. We selected a room and after turning down the bed we found dirty sheets. Tried the shower but water trickled out not run out. When we left early the next day we found the desk clerk on the floor behind the desk sleeping. From beginning to end the stay was the worst of any of our travels. Advice, sleep in the train station before the hotel Oliver.

Reviews.Title: “Too many issues for just one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Tips99
Reviews.Content: I didn't book Oliver Hotel originally, but had to stay there when the hotel that I had originally booked said that there were "health and safety" issues with my room and they had to move me to a nearby hotel. The first problem was with the phone line. My friend could not call her family to inform about the hotel change, as there was simply no phone line available. We later found out that the phones were actually working, but the hotel did not allow people to use them, because they did not have a way to control the length of the calls and charge them later. That's ridiculous! Second and worst issue: my friend arrived before me and made the check-in first. When I arrived, the receptionist gave me the room keys and told me that she had left for a while. After about 20 minutes, I started to get worried that she hadn't come back yet. Then I realised that some of her things in the bedroom were in Italian and we do not speak any Italian! I was given the key to the wrong bedroom! As soon as I realised this, I ran to the reception with all my stuff. The receptionist did not admit that he sent me to the wrong room until I saw the correct room number in the form that my friend filled in at check-in. The receptionist did not apologize for this unacceptable mistake. Thirdly (as if it was not enough), our room was in the basement, located under the reception. We could not sleep due to the sound of steps from the reception and from people on the street during the whole night Other issues: the water in the shower was not hot enough and the breakfast was very poor. I definetly do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst maaged hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: jacshejee
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family for just one night. There was no phone in the room. In the morning when we struggled with either extremely cold or boiling hot water, the manager still argued it was not a big prblem. Not a penny was refunded for the worst hotel experience,rather the manager was very rude and nasty.Never go there !

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: manchestert15
Reviews.Content: it was quite clean but the room was so small and the bathroom was practically in the bedroom ,the water was so hot i would not of put a child in the shower also every time we shut the door it nearly took our hands off it slammed that hard,as for the staff all they said to us was tea or coffee cornflakes OR eggs and that was the conversation for 3 days,luckily we was out all day untill late at night so we wasnt in there very much, but dont expect friendlyness here the receptionist didnt even lift her head up from the desk to say goodbye on our departure,

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: JBSW
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at this hotel because of work commitments(7weeks). Our first room was an absolute hole. The nets hadn't been washed for years and were thick with dust. The room was a shoe box and the bathroom and bedding were stinking. After complaints from ourselves and our company we were moved to a slightly better room, which was cleaner. The breakfast is sub standard (boiled eggs and yoghurts which were on offer at local supermarkets). They also have an ant problem seen visibly by the trail on the tea and coffee table. On most occasions the room was not cleaned adequately and I helped the maid to clean it myself. My advice, give it a miss there are much better and cheaper rooms available in the kensington area!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Bibi7628
Reviews.Content: Despite negative reviews of this hotel, we were very satisfied with our experience. My Mother, my sister and I stayed in a room together. The facilities were adequate, we had the use of the dining room all day. The staff were friendly, and overall, we were quite happy with this centrally located hotel. I would definitely stay there again as it was great value.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: jock221
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to be close to the Stamford Bridge for a match. it was very disappointing, the room was smelly and the covers on the bed were fusty. we had our teenage son with us and his bed was positioned across the bathroom door which had no handle on the outside . every time we need the bathroom we had to move the bed. The breakfast staff all spoke broken english and on the first morning we went down for breakfast and not knowing what was happening we went to the boiler in the corner to pour a coffee and out from behind the hatch this girl bellowed SIT DOWN NOW. we felt about 2ft high. the breakfast was cherry yougart, apples, coffee and toast and if you asked nicely some cereal was provided. this hotel was not cheap . We had to go through the fire escape to get to the lifts and this area was dirty and stinking of smoke were obviously people were using as a smoking area. we will never be back beware

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: SouthAfricaTraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at short notice. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Unfortunately some of them do not understand English very well. The room was small but adequate. We only slept there. Breakfast was included in the price and was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “What's with the grey eggs?”
Reviews.Author: LondonMaud
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking to stay in a centrally located Hotel in London for my 24th birthday. On contacting the Oliver, the receptionist sounded "a mess", not entirely sure of whether she could book us into a double room. following various phone calls, she finally manged to organise herself and get us in. 60 quid, not so bad considering the location for a double room. In hindsight, it may have been a large, or should that be enlarged single.. Our room was on the first floor, bonus, but on opening the door I was greeted with what can only be described as a nuclear heat wave. Ah well, I thought, maybe I'll open the window... NO CHANCE! Window was the size of a small child and utterly smattered in pigeons poo. I arrived late at night so didn't quite understand the reason for this until the next day. Opening the barely locked window, I discovered it looked out onto the side of the building. In this alleyway there was not one, not two, but three pigeon's nests and spikes to prevent said pigeons. As well as mounds, and I mean mounds of more pigeons mess. Utterly vile and completely unhygenic. I'm quite surprised one of the little blighters didn't come in for a nose around. Breakfast, we were told was served from 7.30 to 9.30. As our night's sleep was interrupted by various sirens, traffic and the unberably hot room preventing us from getting any rest, we slightly overslept and got to breakfast at 9.20. Reasonable I thought, oh no. We were ignored until 9.35, at which time I had to attract the waitresses attention with a polite "excuse me, can we order some breakfast?" She glared at the clock, about to completely refuse my offer when I again politely informed her that we had been sitting there for 15 mins. She disappeared and slammed down our new cutlery and plates and informed us of the varied and high quality choice of breakfast which was egg or cereal. The manner of this particular waitress was utterly inexcusable, she treated us as if we'd just slaughtered a small puppy. Not 5 mins later, an elderly couple appeared, confused as to what time breakfast was, and at one point it seemed that she was about to refuse them food. Luckily they were fed the same high quality rubbish that we had. And all on my 24th birthday. Utterly disgraceful. Give this place a wide berth in future. Unless, of course you fancy taking home a few pigeony friends with you.

Reviews.Title: “Rude receptionists. unclean bedrooms - beware of room 18....”
Reviews.Author: justme4U
Reviews.Content: this is really an hotel on a budget. the people are not friendly. the breakfast is hard swalled. Is nonetheless conveniently located but the way they treat you does not make you whish to return. never again no.

Reviews.Title: “One can stay for 2-3 nights. Not a bad hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Review55
Reviews.Content: When I had read the posts here before staying at this hotel, I had said "oh my god". But still, I paid a visit and saw the place by myself and decided to stay in a single room after seeing the place. Negatives: The rooms are small (this is not new in London), the curtains are dirty. There is no shampoo or shower gel in the bath room. Overall the room looks a little old. Positives: Bed, cushion, towels are clean, there is a TV and hair dryer in the room, and also a heater, all in good working condition. The hotel is in a very central location. There is en-suite toilet&shower in the room. Breakfast is OK (4 slices of toast, butter, cream cheese, jam, tea or coffee, an apple, a boiled egg or corn flakes). The staff at reception was very helpful and friendly. There is 24 hour reception. There is a TV room and breakfast room, where you can have tea, coffee or water anytime This is not a luxurious hotel, but one can definitely stay for 2-3 nights and is value for money. Overall, I was happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.Never Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Dragonsrule
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aug 2006 holiday weekend. Rooms very small , beds old and extremely bad condition,carpet dirty. Breakfast staff extremely rude (Breakfast Boiled egg or cornflakes.) One not BOTH for 4 days in day row. Beware try anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights after they messed up our booking and we were put in the basement very old, smelly and the beds were hard, the rooms tiny and dirty had my children and was not happy would not recomend it to anyone but did love London and can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daydreming
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oliver for 3 nights at the end of May, and while the room and connecting bathroom were very small, the room was clean and quiet. The room was warm, even though it was rainy and cool outside. We were unable to take advantage of the included breakfast, as the dining area always appeared to be full, with no where to sit. Luckily, there is a 'Baker's Oven' directly across from the underground station, so we were able to pick up something to eat as we began our days adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Barely adequate”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled2006
Reviews.Content: Reasonably smart frontage but idiosyncratic check-in staff, more concerned with controlling their image and being officious than providing genuinely welcoming customer service. Room barely adequate - even allowing for relatively cheap rate obtained through web search. Bed not bad though base material torn. Curtains too short for window, letting bright light through over bed. En-suite toilet superficially clean in appearance but dirty/urine smell in area. Breakfast - hard boiled sulphorous egg with toast and butter no margarine available. Waited at empty check out desk (staff away) and then left keys on desk after a few mins - all of this watched by owner from a distance sat talking to friend(s), did not offer so much as a thank you. Won't go back, ever.

Reviews.Title: “horrible and fleas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came down to London with young people who I work with and some workers. The staff friendly and nice and from the outside really nice to look at. However, when we got in, you could smell the damp and it was really old fashioned and grim. Ordered three rooms - one single, two twins. The twins smelt of damp as soon as you opened the door. Ther was not a proper shower in the bathboom. The bathroom did look modernised but I felt nervous about having a wash in there and so did the others as did not look clean. The rooms were boiling even though the raditors weren't on so we had to leave the windows open which caused alot of noise from the traffic which went on all the night. The beds were hard and it had an awful rough blanket on which didn't look or smell clean so that was off putting. Came back from a show wanting a cup of tea went into the coffee/breakfast room and the cups were dirty, the kitchen was unclean, the kettle was dirty and the tea and coffee were left in maragine tubs which did not look attractive or like I wanted to drink from it. So I didn't have a cup of tea which I was really disappointed about Managed to sleep relatively okay despite the TV next door being contanstly on and the noise of the traffic. Was really looking forward to my breakfast as it boosted of a contential breakfast. Which in my mind is croissates, smoked ham, yogurt, selection of breakfast cereals. No, we got an apple (no choice) slammed on the table, rubbish and vile orange juice, was offered cereral which was really cheap and was left unopened over night as I saw it in the kitchen the night before. The tea and coffee were in old fashioned and dirty teapots. I hated the breakfast and so did the young people. You had no choice. We also was offered an egg. I think in total the breakfast per person was £1 worth of the money you paid it was really poor! Overall, I was really disappointed because for the young people it was there first time that they went to London and stayed in a hotel. These young people are homeless and there hostel and standard of living is better than that living in a YMCA than the hotel. Also myself and my work collegue had flea bites when we got up so we have to get some ointment. It was from the hotel because we did not have them before we entered there!!!! I am itching as I am writing this If you are looking for something cheap and nasty and this is the place. The staff were nice but terrible hotel

HotelInfo.Name: Oliver Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 198 Cromwell Road | Earl's Court, London SW5 0SN, England
